Wear a hat or a scarf to cover your head: This is the most obvious and practical solution to protect your head from sunburn. You can wear a wide-brimmed hat or a baseball cap that covers your entire head, or a scarf that can be tied around your neck and draped over your head.
Use sunscreen: Apply sunscreen on your scalp to protect it from sunburn. You can use a broad-spectrum sunscreen with an SPF of at least 30 and reapply it regularly.
Wear a beanie or a cap with a UPF (Ultraviolet Protection Factor): A beanie or a cap with a UPF of at least 50 can provide additional protection from the sun's harmful rays.

Use a hair fiber or hair loss concealer: If you're concerned about the appearance of your bald head, you can use a hair fiber or a hair loss concealer to give the appearance of hair. These products can also provide some protection from the sun.

Wear a turban or a headscarf: If you prefer to wear a headscarf or a turban, you can choose one that is made of a breathable material and has a UPF of at least 50. You can also apply sunscreen on your scalp before wearing a headscarf or a turban.
